summary: This is a formal discovery and Brady request letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys (Cohen & Gresser LLP) to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The letter requests extensive materials related to the criminal case against Maxwell, including information about victims, witnesses, the 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement with Jeffrey Epstein, and various government investigations.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The client of Cohen & Gresser LLP, who is the subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) and for whom extensive discovery is being requested.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Repeatedly referenced as the central figure in the underlying abuse allegations; the letter requests materials related to his 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement and communications with his attorneys.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney at Cohen & Gresser LLP who signed the discovery request letter on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Bradley Edwards
persons.context: Listed among the 'Attorneys' representing victims in the case; the letter requests communications between these attorneys and prosecutors.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Listed among the 'Attorneys' representing victims in the case; the letter requests communications between these attorneys and prosecutors.

connections.description: Maxwell is charged in connection with Epstein's alleged sexual abuse of minors; the defense requests materials about their relationship and communications.
Everdell is writing the discovery request letter as Maxwell's defense attorney.
Edwards is listed as an attorney for victims making allegations against Maxwell, and the defense requests communications between such attorneys and prosecutors.
Boies is listed as an attorney for victims making allegations against Maxwell.
Edwards is described as an attorney for Epstein's victims in the referenced book 'Relentless Pursuit'.

events.title: Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement Signed
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signed a Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) with the government, which the defense seeks all communications about.

events.title: Attorneys Meet with SDNY Prosecutors
events.description: Certain victim attorneys met with SDNY prosecutors to ask them to initiate a criminal investigation into Epstein and Maxwell.

events.title: SDNY Investigation Begins
events.description: The government asserts it began the SDNY investigation into Epstein and Maxwell around this time.

events.title: Deadline for Government Response
events.description: The defense requests a response from the government by this date regarding their discovery requests.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The defense is requesting the identities and complete birthdays of the individuals identified in the indictment as Minor Victims 1-3.
The letter reveals the existence of a 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) signed by Jeffrey Epstein and seeks all communications about its negotiation.
The defense references a book/memoir titled 'The Billionaires Playboy Club' that was produced by the government and requests all versions and drafts.
The letter mentions that victim attorneys met with SDNY prosecutors in 2016 to urge a criminal investigation into Epstein and Maxwell, which SDNY declined at that time.
The defense requests the complete FBI case file regarding the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein for obstruction of justice.
